title: US to Roll Out Visa Restrictions on People Who Misuse Spyware to Target Journalists, Activists
description:
Officials said the visa restriction policy can apply to citizens of any country found to have misused or facilitated the malign use of spyware

The post US to Roll Out Visa Restrictions on People Who Misuse Spyware to Target Journalists, Activists appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Mitsubishi Electric Factory Automation Flaws Expose Engineering Workstations
description:
Critical and high-severity Mitsubishi Electric Factory Automation vulnerabilities can allow privileged access to engineering workstations. 

The post Mitsubishi Electric Factory Automation Flaws Expose Engineering Workstations appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Google Contributes $1 Million to Rust, Says It Prevented Hundreds of Android Vulnerabilities
description:
Google announces $1 million investment in improving Rust’s interoperability with legacy C++ codebases.

The post Google Contributes $1 Million to Rust, Says It Prevented Hundreds of Android Vulnerabilities appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: QNAP Patches High-Severity Bugs in QTS, Qsync Central
description:
Two high-severity vulnerabilities in QNAP’s operating system could lead to command execution over the network.

The post QNAP Patches High-Severity Bugs in QTS, Qsync Central appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Google Open Sources AI-Aided Fuzzing Framework
description:
Google has released its fuzzing framework in open source to boost the ability of developers and researchers to identify vulnerabilities.

The post Google Open Sources AI-Aided Fuzzing Framework appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Airbus App Vulnerability Introduced Aircraft Safety Risk: Security Firm
description:
Navblue Flysmart+ Manager allowed attackers to modify aircraft engine performance calculation, intercept data.

The post Airbus App Vulnerability Introduced Aircraft Safety Risk: Security Firm appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: OT Maintenance Is Primary Source of OT Security Incidents: Report
description:
A new ICS security report from TXOne Networks says many OT security incidents involved ransomware and vulnerability exploitation. 

The post OT Maintenance Is Primary Source of OT Security Incidents: Report appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: AnyDesk Revokes Passwords, Certificates in Response to Hack
description:
AnyDesk is revoking certificates and passwords in response to a recently discovered security breach impacting production systems.

The post AnyDesk Revokes Passwords, Certificates in Response to Hack appeared first on SecurityWeek.
